definition: to hold nothing back/without reservation
hair/drawing brush/(in the) least/one thousandth/currency unit, 0.1 yuan
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: The issue will be thoroughly aired.
sentences.chinese: 這條消息將毫無保留地公佈於世。

sentences.english: Cesar and I had been together for two years. I loved him completely.
sentences.chinese: 我和塞薩爾在一起兩年了，我毫無保留地愛着他。

sentences.english: I give my apology sincerely to you all, unreservedly and with my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我發自肺腑地毫無保留地向你們所有的人道歉。

sentences.english: She has devoted herself unreservedly to the great cause.
sentences.chinese: 她毫無保留地獻身於這偉大的事業。

sentences.english: We thank you for your unsparing love and support all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我們感謝大家一直以來所獻上的毫無保留的愛和支持。

sentences.english: Beause you come to me with naught save love.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你來到我身邊，毫無保留的愛我。

sentences.english: Kate told me her mind without reserve.
sentences.chinese: 凱特毫無保留地和我談心。

sentences.english: I agree without any reservation that climate change has to be tackled sooner that later.
sentences.chinese: 我毫無保留完全同意應對氣候變化當趁早不趕晚。

sentences.english: Real love gets involved-all the way.
sentences.chinese: 真愛會積極參與，而且是毫無保留的參與。

sentences.english: He and his partner had made a bargain to tell each other everything.
sentences.chinese: 他和他的合夥人約定，要互通信息，毫無保留。

sentences.english: This irrational fallacy has already been inherited by us, without reservations.
sentences.chinese: 這一非理性的錯誤已被我們毫無保留地繼承下來。

sentences.english: Their support to the Constitution was reported to be “without reservation”.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，它們對《組織法》的支持據說“毫無保留”。

sentences.english: Now they have both in the unconditional love of my family.
sentences.chinese: 如今，她倆生活在我們家中的毫無保留的愛當中。

sentences.english: They unreservedly passed on to us their technical know-how.
sentences.chinese: 他們把技術知識毫無保留地傳授給了我們。

sentences.english: He spoke without reserve of his time in prison.
sentences.chinese: 他毫無保留地述說了他在監獄中的事。

sentences.english: It spreaded the leaves, showing the beauty unreservedly, my seductive.
sentences.chinese: 它伸展着葉子，毫無保留地展示着美麗，我的小妖精。

definition: not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
selfless/unselfish/disinterested/altruistic
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
to forget
variant of 給予|给予[ji3 yu3]
candid/frank/plain dealing
no complaints/to have no regrets
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
one's conduct and deeds
to realize/realization
rare and precious/valuable/remarkable
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
unswerving from start to finish (idiom)
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
